intro: Mesembryanthemum patulum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ice plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent characteristics and ability to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in spring and summer. Its leaves are narrow and fleshy, adapted to store water, and it has a low-growing, spreading habit. Mesembryanthemum patulum is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
